byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Memo From Jerusalem; many Israelis are bewildered by nonstop criticism of Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu by Obama administration, helping sink Israel-United States relations to its lowest point in quarter century; even critics who mostly blame Netanyahu for antagonizing Pres Obama over last six years now see situation reversed.
lead_paragraph: Tensions between Israel and the U.S. have soared, and even Benjamin Netanyahu’s critics have been astonished by President Obama’s criticism of the Israeli leader.

headline.main: Rebukes From White House Risk Buoying Netanyahu
headline.print_headline: Rebukes by White House Risk Buoying Netanyahu

snippet: Tensions between Israel and the U.S. have soared, and even Benjamin Netanyahu’s critics have been astonished by President Obama’s criticism of the Israeli leader.
